WCSR is honoring your high school seniors!
Spread the word to your graduates families!
From now through May 10th
Log onto www.radiohillsdale.com and go to the Senior Salute tab for details and to submit your graduate.
Then e-mail the picture and audio recording to wcsrinc@gmail.com.
Through the end of May
Seniors will be featured on our Senior Salute page at RadioHillsdale.com and on our social media
Your audio greeting is rotated with other participating families on 92.1!
**************************************************************************************
BROKEN DEVICES
If you have a broken Chromebook or iPad,
please email Mark Sexton at:
msexton@jonesvilleschools.org
He will help schedule a time for repair/replacement with you.
************************************************************************************

strong.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;
strong.span:
Jonesville Community Schools Board of Education Meeting
Thursday, April 23, 2020 at 6:00pm.

br.span:
Executive Order 2020-42 prohibits all public gatherings of any number of people until after April 30th, 2020. This requires the Jonesville Community Schools
Board of Education to meet electronically.

HOTSPOT INFORMATION
If you currently don't have internet at home, but have a cell phone, more than likely, your cell phone provider has given you free data to use as a mobile hotspot.
Please click HERE for more information.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;

div.p:
In order to help families who may be struggling during the shut down,the JonesvilleCommunity Schooldistrict has created a take out meals day. Prepared meals are available forallchildren in the community ages 18 and under. Children are not required to be ofschool age or to attend Jonesville Schools to get a meal. Other schools are also providing this service for all children in the county. Our pick up schedule is as follows:
Tuesday, April 7th from 11:30 to 1:00, breakfasts and lunches for four days
Starting Monday April 13th and each Monday thereafter from 11:30 to 1:00
lunches and breakfasts for the week will be available
Please enter theMaumee Street lot, stay in your vehicle, andmeals will be brought to you..

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;

div.p: We hope that you are all safe and sound. Remember to have your children check for their schoolwork and stay on a normal schedule as much as possible.

br.em:
What is Buddy Reading:
Buddy Reading is a reading program using volunteers as mentors and tutors. The goal of Buddy Reading is to assist students who may be good readers but could use additional help to become more successful readers and confident students. Please use the link below for more information.

br.strong:
*** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** ***
A Comprehensive Cyberbullying Guide for Parents

br.span: Please use the link below for important information regarding cyberbullying.

a.style: color: rgb(17, 85, 204); font-family: arial, sans-serif; font-size: 12.8px;

br.span:
You are your childs first teacher and reading with your child is a proven way to promote early literacy. Helping make sure your child is reading on grade level by third grade is one of the most important things you can do to prepare them for their future. By reading with your child for 20 minutes per day and trying a few simple strategies, you can make a positive impact on your childs success in school. Check out our strategies below!
CLICK HERE FOR STRATEGIES

span.style: line-height: 18.66px; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(255, 114, 22);
line-height: 20px; font-family: verdana, arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(66, 66, 66);
font-size: 11pt; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);

span.span: Robert Thompson graduated from Jonesville Community Schools in 1950. He and his wife donated funds to Jonesville schools so that each student could have a Chromebook or an Ipad to enhance their learning. They also provided funds to purchase the tools for our Industrial Arts labs and computer labs and video cameras for our broadcasting department. Our students are truly benefitting from their generosity. In addition to all of the wonderful devices, equipment and training, they are helping to provide for the future of our students. Ellen devised the Working Families Scholarship that helps families pay for college. It is amazing and we are extremely grateful for the Thompsons.

br.h3:
Jonesville Kindergareten Registration for 2019-2020 is
March 13 and March 14, 2019. Call now for an appointment 517-849-9175.

span.style: line-height: 18.66px; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(255, 114, 22);

br.h4: Parents of Jonesville Community Schools students, and employees of the school system, are automatically enrolled in the Skylert notification system. JCS central offices and schools use Skylert tocommunicate emergencies, school closing information, attendance, food service, and general messages (this includes news and announcements from your child's school). It is important for parents to keep their childs emergency contact information up to date. If you are not receiving these messages, please contact your child's school to update your information. To remove or change your notifications, please login to Skyward, then click on Skylert on the left hand side of the page. If you are unable to login to Skyward, please contact your child's school for assistance. Additional school closing information can be found HERE.
